content: nancy s waves scarf finished size 6 ½ x 72 blocked yarn noro kureyon sock yarn 70% wool/30% nylon fingering weight 100 grams 420 meters or any sock weight yarn hook hamanaka 6 00/u s e 3 5 notions yarn needle gauge gauge is not important to this project abbreviations used this pattern is written using american crochet terms chain chain st stitch sts stitches single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble or triple crochet blo back loop only * stitch pattern adapted from mypicot com http //www mypicot com/crochet_patterns_mc1005 html instructions chain 34 row 1 single_crochet in second chain from hook and each chain across 33 sts row 2 chain 1 turn single_crochet in same st and next st *chain 1 skip next stitch half_double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st treble_crochet in next stitch chain 1 skip next stitch treble_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st double_crochet in next stitch chain 1 skip next st half_double_crochet in next stitch* chain 1 skip next st single_crochet in next three sts repeat from * to * once chain 1 skip next st single_crochet in last two sts row 3 chain 1 turn single_crochet in same st and in each st and chain 1 space across row 4 chain 1 turn single_crochet in blo of same st single_crochet in blo of each st across row 5 chain 4 counts as first treble_crochet turn treble_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st half_double_crochet in next st *chain 1 skip next st single_crochet in next three sts chain 1 skip next st half_double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st treble_crochet in next st* chain 1 skip next st treble_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st double_crochet in next st chain 1 skip next st half_double_crochet in next st repeat from * to * once treble_crochet in last stitch row 6 chain 1 turn single_crochet in same st and in each st and chain 1 space across row 7 chain 1 turn single_crochet in blo of same st single_crochet in blo of each st across repeat row 2 7 until scarf is desired length ending with a row 3 row finish off using yarn needle weave in ends note i think this pattern could easily be adapted to any weight yarn using an appropriate size hook and knowing that the scarf would obviously be wider with a heavier weight yarn © 2009 cori dodds this is an original design
